title: iPhone 16 price drops by 20%, iPhone 15 by 18.5% during Flipkart, Amazon Republic Day sale events - The Financial Express
summary:
iPhone prices have dropped with popular ecommerce platforms like Flipkart and Amazon lining up to offer Apple’s latest at all-time-low prices.

Publication Date: January 14, 2025

Source: Financial Express

iPhone prices have dropped with popular ecommerce platforms like Flipkart and Amazon offering significant discounts during their Republic Day sales. The iPhone 16 is now available with a nearly 20% discount, while the iPhone 15 sees an 18.5% reduction, making this a prime time for potential buyers.

Key Points:

  • The iPhone 16's price reduced from Rs 79,900 to Rs 63,999 on Flipkart.
  • The iPhone 15 is priced at Rs 56,999 during the Amazon sale.
  • Additional discounts available through bank offers can lower the prices further.
  • Both sales run from January 14 to January 19, 2025.
newTitle: iPhone 16 and 15 Price Cuts During Republic Day Sale on Flipkart and Amazon

title: WhatsApp update brings double tap reactions, selfie stickers, and shareable packs - The Indian Express
summary:
WhatsApp Update Introduces Double Tap Reactions and Selfie Stickers

Publication Date: January 15, 2025
Source: Indian Express

WhatsApp is rolling out its first update of 2025, featuring new functionalities like double tap reactions, creating stickers from selfies, and sharing sticker packs.

  • Users can choose from 30 backgrounds, effects, and filters when using the built-in camera.
  • A new 'Create sticker' button allows users to turn selfies into stickers easily.
  • Sticker packs can now be shared directly within chat, enhancing user interaction.
  • Double tap reaction functionality speeds up message responses compared to the previous method.
  • Future updates may introduce a new 'AIs' tab for creating custom AI chatbots and accessing AI services.
The update allows users to react to messages more quickly with a simple double-tap.

This update signifies WhatsApp's commitment to enhancing user experience and integrating new technologies.
newTitle: WhatsApp Update Introduces Double Tap Reactions and Selfie Stickers

title: Supreme Court stays arrest of ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC cheating case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Supreme Court Stays Arrest of Former IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

Date: Jan 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has ordered a stay on the arrest of former IAS officer Puja Khedkar, accused of fraudulently appearing for the UPSC civil service examination in 2022. The court issued a notice to the Delhi Police and the UPSC regarding her plea for anticipatory bail.

  • Puja Khedkar is accused of misrepresenting information to avail reservation benefits in her UPSC application.
  • The Delhi High Court previously rejected her anticipatory bail request, citing a strong prima facie case.
  • The Supreme Court has scheduled a hearing for February 14 and ordered that no coercive action be taken against her in the meantime.
  • Delhi Police assert that a deeper investigation is needed due to emerging conspiracy allegations.
“It's a classic example of fraud, not only with a constitutional body but also with society and the nation as a whole.”

The Supreme Court's intervention provides temporary relief to Khedkar as the legal battle continues around her allegations.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays Arrest of Former IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

title: How to diagnose obesity: Lancet Commission recommends focussing on fat distribution, not just BMI. Here’s why it is significant - The Indian Express
summary:
Lancet Commission Proposes New Guidelines for Diagnosing Obesity

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Lancet Diabetes & Endocrinology Commission has introduced a new approach to diagnosing obesity, emphasizing the importance of fat distribution over the traditional BMI method.

  • The commission suggests combining BMI with additional body measurements, such as waist circumference or waist-to-hip ratio.
  • Direct assessments of body fat, such as DEXA scans, are recommended for more accurate diagnoses.
  • Two new categories of obesity have been introduced: clinical obesity and pre-clinical obesity.
  • The focus on abdominal obesity is particularly relevant in India due to high prevalence and health risks associated with it.
  • Current recommendations aim to improve diagnosis, treatment, and understanding of obesity-related health risks.
“Moving beyond BMI-only approaches helps prevent under and over diagnosis of obesity-related health risks.” – Dr. Anoop Misra

This new framework aims to provide personalized treatment strategies that consider individual metabolic profiles and risks.
newTitle: Lancet Commission Proposes New Guidelines for Diagnosing Obesity

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX launches two private lunar landers - The Times of India
SpaceX launches two pvt lunar landers towards moon in roundabout journey - Business Standard
summary:
SpaceX Launches Two Private Lunar Landers Towards the Moon

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

SpaceX successfully launched two lunar landers for US and Japanese companies, marking a significant step in private lunar exploration.

  • SpaceX's launch took place at NASA's Kennedy Space Centre.
  • The landers are taking different routes to the moon, with ispace's lander carrying a rover to gather lunar soil.
  • Firefly Aerospace is conducting NASA experiments, including tools to analyze lunar temperature and protect equipment.
  • ispace's lander, Resilience, will take longer to reach the moon than Firefly's Blue Ghost.
  • NASA's Artemis program aims to return astronauts to the moon by the end of the decade.
"We don't think this is a race... but it's not about the speed," said ispace's CEO Takeshi Hakamada.

Both companies acknowledge the risks involved in reaching the lunar surface, with ongoing advancements in lunar technology crucial for future missions.
newTitle: SpaceX Launches Two Private Lunar Landers Towards the Moon

title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale is LIVE: Up to 75% off on home audio from top brands like Sony, Marshall and more - Hindustan Times

9A, Kotla Road: Congress gets new headquarters ‘Indira Bhawan’ in Sonia Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge's presence - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Inaugurates New Headquarters 'Indira Bhawan' in New Delhi

Date: Jan 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has officially inaugurated its new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, at 9A Kotla Road in New Delhi, marking a significant transition after 47 years at its previous location, 24 Akbar Road.

  • Sonia Gandhi, Congress Parliamentary Party chief, led the inauguration ceremony.
  • Key party leaders including Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi participated in the event.
  • The move symbolizes a potential resurgence for the party following losses in recent elections.
  • Supporting speeches emphasized the significance of this new beginning for the party and nation.
  • Rahul Gandhi criticized RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's remarks about the Indian Constitution during the event.
"It is a new beginning. We are very happy that we have a new headquarters. I hope this will bring better things for the party and the country." - Sachin Pilot

The inauguration of Indira Bhawan is seen as a strategic move for the Congress party, aiming to revitalize its operations and outreach as it navigates through challenging political waters.
newTitle: Congress Inaugurates New Headquarters 'Indira Bhawan' in New Delhi

title: When Sharmila Tagore spoke about converting to Islam when she married Tiger Pataudi: 'You couldn't be fli - TOI Etimes
summary:
When Sharmila Tagore spoke about converting to Islam when she married Tiger Pataudi: 'You couldn't be flippant...'

Published on: N/A Source: Times of India

Sharmila Tagore shares her personal journey of converting to Islam upon marrying Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi, emphasizing the challenges faced in their interfaith union.

  • Sharmila converted to Islam to marry Tiger Pataudi, revealing the complexities involved.
  • She expressed that the conversion was neither easy nor hard, and one had to face it sincerely.
  • Sharmila learned more about both Hinduism and Islam after her conversion.
  • She shared her first meeting with her mother-in-law and the respectful bond they formed.
  • Despite receiving death threats during their wedding preparations, the ceremony went smoothly.
“In Kolkata, when I was getting married, my parents were getting telegrams saying that bullets shall speak... despite the tension, the wedding and reception went smoothly.” - Sharmila Tagore

This personal account highlights the societal pressures and deep commitment within their interfaith marriage.
newTitle: Sharmila Tagore Reflects on Converting to Islam for Marriage to Tiger Pataudi

title: ‘Mohan Bhagwat has committed treason… attacked the Constitution’: Rahul Gandhi at launch of Congress’s new headquarters - The Indian Express
summary:
‘We are fighting BJP, RSS, and the Indian state itself’: Rahul Gandhi hits out at Mohan Bhagwat

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

During the inauguration of Congress's new headquarters, Rahul Gandhi criticized BJP and RSS for allegedly capturing all institutions in India, asserting that Mohan Bhagwat's comments on India's independence were treasonous.

  • Gandhi claimed that the RSS chief's remarks undermined the true significance of India's independence in 1947.
  • He emphasized the Congress vision as one that respects diverse languages and cultures.
  • Gandhi described Bhagwat's perspective as a centralized ideology that threatens democratic values.
  • He warned against the agenda that seeks to suppress the voices of marginalized communities in India.
“To say that India did not get Independence in 1947 is an insult to every single Indian.” - Rahul Gandhi

The confrontation highlights an ideological clash between Congress and RSS, with Gandhi positioning Congress as the defender of India's secular and democratic fabric.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Criticizes RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat at Congress Headquarters Inauguration

NASA Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Launch to the Moon: When, Where, and How to Watch - Moneycontrol
summary:
NASA Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Launch to the Moon: When, Where, and How to Watch

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost moon lander is set to launch on Wednesday, January 15, bringing NASA’s innovative payloads to the lunar surface.

  • The mission promises insights into Earth's magnetosphere and its interaction with space weather.
  • Launch aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket at 1:11 a.m. EST (0611 GMT) from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida.
  • Among the payloads is NASA’s Lunar Environment Heliospheric X-ray Imager (LEXI).
"We expect to see the magnetosphere breathing out and in," said Hyunju Connor, an astrophysicist at NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center. "It will shrink when the solar wind strengthens and expand when it weakens."

This mission marks a significant step in understanding how solar winds affect Earth's magnetosphere and will provide crucial data for future space weather research.
newTitle: NASA Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Launch to the Moon: When, Where, and How to Watch

Galaxy S25 Ultra to launch with groundbreaking AI feature, Samsung says it draws anything you can imagine - The Financial Express
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Set to Launch with Innovative AI Features

Date: January 22, 2025 Source: Financial Express

Samsung is set to launch the highly anticipated Galaxy S25 series on January 22, featuring groundbreaking updates to its AI capabilities.

  • Launch date is confirmed for January 22, 2025.
  • Major upgrades to the “Sketch to Image” feature are implemented.
  • The upgraded tool will allow users to generate images from sketches as well as text prompts.
  • The S25 Ultra is expected to have an S-Pen, which enhances the drawing capabilities.
  • Promotional leaks suggest a deep blue color scheme for the S25 series.
“If it can be envisioned, Galaxy AI can create it.”

With the arrival of the Galaxy S25 series, Samsung aims to redefine mobile AI, offering new functionalities that will likely have lasting implications on user experience.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Set to Launch with Innovative AI Features

summary:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As Axis Bank, Mahindra & Mahindra Drag

Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The stock market opened higher but has shown a flat trend throughout the day, primarily influenced by Axis Bank and Mahindra & Mahindra's performance.

  • Reliance Industries Ltd., HDFC Bank Ltd., Maruti Suzuki Ltd., Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd., and Larsen & Toubro have been added to the Nifty 50 index.
  • Axis Bank shares fell by 3.20% to Rs 1,018 after a large block deal involving over 3.32 million shares.
  • Maharashtra Scooters experienced a rise in shares as its net profit more than doubled to Rs 3.3 crore.
  • Trent shares increased by over 5% following a 'buy' rating from Elara Capital.
  • Alembic Pharma announced receiving final USFDA approval for Brexpiprazole Tablets, an important development in the pharmaceutical sector.
"Maharashtra Scooters highlights: Net Profit doubles to Rs 3.3 crore versus Rs 1 crore. Revenue rises to Rs 5.8 crore versus Rs 6.4 crore."

This trading session indicates a mixed sentiment among investors, influenced by major stocks' fluctuating performances.

title: Mahakumbh 2025 Live: Devotees take holy dip at Triveni Sangam on day 3 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025: Day 3 Highlights at Triveni Sangam

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

On the third day of the Mahakumbh Mela, over 35 million devotees gathered at Triveni Sangam for a holy dip, marking the Makar Sankranti festival. The event continues to draw immense crowds as preparations for upcoming bathing days are underway.

Key Points

  • More than 35 million devotees participated on the first 'Amrit Snan' day, according to UP CM Yogi Adityanath.
  • Naga Sadhus led the procession of akharas for the holy bath.
  • The Mahakumbh Mela, occurring every 12 years, began on January 13 and will conclude on February 26.
  • Schools in Prayagraj for classes 1 to 8 are closed due to traffic congestion related to the event.
“Today, on the first Amrit Snan festival, more than 3.50 crore revered saints and devotees earned the holy benefit of bathing in the uninterrupted-clean Triveni.” – Yogi Adityanath

The Mahakumbh Mela is expected to gather up to 450 million attendees throughout its duration, highlighting the significance and scale of this religious event.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025: Day 3 Highlights at Triveni Sangam

title: India Stars Carrying Over 150 Kg Luggage Sent Strong Message By BCCI, "Red Flag" Raised For This Act - NDTV Sports
summary:
BCCI Raises Concerns Over Indian Players' Excess Luggage and Tour Conduct

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The BCCI is implementing new rules regarding player conduct and baggage limits following India's disappointing tour of Australia, which saw them lose 1-3 in the Test series.

  • The BCCI may limit the presence of family members during tours to a maximum of two weeks for longer tours.
  • Players might be required to only use the team bus for transportation during assignments.
  • Personal managers of players are discouraged from traveling on the team bus.
  • New rules will enforce a luggage limit of 150kg; anything over that must be paid for by the players.
  • The measures follow discussions in a review meeting after a disappointing tour and a failure to qualify for the World Test Championship final.
The other interesting thing that caught my eye is BCCI will pay till 150kgs for a player baggage. Over and above to be paid by the player. Why would anyone need over 150 kgs of luggage on a cricket tour?? — Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) January 14, 2025

This move highlights the BCCI's intent to enforce stricter regulations around player conduct and manage the logistics of cricket tours more effectively.
newTitle: BCCI Raises Concerns Over Indian Players' Excess Luggage and Tour Conduct

title: India Stars Carrying Over 150 Kg Luggage Sent Strong Message By BCCI, "Red Flag" Raised For This Act.. - NDTV Sports
Older than Planet Earth: 100-kg meteor, dating back to 4.6 billion years, unveils secrets of our solar system | Mint - Mint
summary:
Older than Planet Earth: 100-kg meteor, dating back to 4.6 billion years, unveils secrets of our solar system

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

This remarkable meteorite, discovered in Australia, dates back over 4.6 billion years and provides insights into the early solar system's formation.

  1. The Murchison meteorite fell in 1969, shortly after the Moon landing.
  2. It weighs approximately 100 kg and contains pre-solar grains formed in ancient stars.
  3. Rich in organic compounds, the meteorite may hold clues to the origins of life on Earth.
  4. Scientists believe this meteorite serves as a window into the universe's earliest days.
“Holding a rock that contains tiny crystals that are maybe three or four billion years older than our planet is pretty awesome,” - Dermot Henry, Museums Victoria.

This meteorite exemplifies how scientific exploration can lead to significant discoveries about our universe, illustrating the importance of studying such cosmic phenomena.
newTitle: 100-kg Meteor Older than Earth Reveals Solar System Secrets

title: Delhi dense fog: Over 100 flights delayed at IGI Airport; 26 trains hit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Dense Fog: Over 100 Flights Delayed at IGI Airport; 26 Trains Hit

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The dense fog in Delhi-NCR caused almost zero visibility conditions, leading to delays of over 100 flights and 26 trains on Wednesday.

  • Thick fog resulted in significant travel disruptions in the Delhi-NCR region.
  • More than 100 flights were delayed at Indira Gandhi International Airport; none were diverted or canceled.
  • A total of 26 trains experienced delays, with some exceeding 300 minutes.
  • India Meteorological Department predicted light rain for the day.
“Low visibility and fog over Delhi may lead to some delays.” - IndiGo Airlines

The situation is expected to persist for the next few days, affecting transportation in neighboring regions as well.
newTitle: Delhi Dense Fog Causes Delays to Flights and Trains

title: Delhi liquor policy scam: MHA grants ED sanction to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in excise policy case - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi liquor policy scam: MHA grants ED sanction to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in excise policy case

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Union Home Ministry has sanctioned the Enforcement Directorate to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in connection with a money laundering case linked to the excise policy.

  • The Enforcement Directorate filed a chargesheet after arresting Kejriwal in March 2024.
  • The MHA's sanction comes just ahead of the Delhi Assembly elections on February 5, 2025.
  • Kejriwal and AAP have been accused of involvement in corrupt practices related to the 2021-22 excise policy.
  • V K Saxena, the Delhi Lieutenant Governor, had recommended a CBI probe into alleged irregularities leading to the ED's investigation.
"Kejriwal was called the 'kingpin and key conspirator' of the Delhi excise scam by the ED."

This development is critical in the context of the upcoming elections and raises significant questions about governance and accountability in the Delhi government.
newTitle: Delhi liquor policy scam: MHA grants ED sanction to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in excise policy case

title: Neither GQG nor LIC, mutual funds played Adani bull in Q3 - The Economic Times
Impeached South Korean President Yoon arrested in second attempt over martial law imposition - The Indian Express
summary:
Impeached South Korean President Yoon Arrested in Second Attempt Over Martial Law Imposition

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Indian Express

South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol was arrested by law enforcement officials on Wednesday, marking the first time in the country's history that a sitting president has been detained. He faces charges of insurrection over his imposition of a brief period of martial law last month.

  • Yoon’s arrest highlights escalating political turmoil in South Korea.
  • Over 1,000 anti-corruption investigators and police participated in the arrest.
  • Previous attempts to arrest Yoon had failed due to resistance from security officials.
  • Yoon's martial law declaration sparked widespread outrage and led to his impeachment.
“Today, when I saw them invading the security perimeter with fire equipment, I decided to appear before the CIO, even though it is an illegal investigation.” - Yoon Suk Yeol

This unprecedented arrest of a sitting leader has drawn significant attention as the Constitutional Court deliberates on Yoon's future in office and the legitimacy of the charges against him.
newTitle: Impeached South Korean President Yoon Arrested Amid Political Turmoil

title: Health checks and suit installs before Thursday ISS spacewalk for science upkeep - Space Daily
OpenAI rolls out assistant-like feature ‘Tasks’ to take on Alexa, Siri - The Hindu
summary:
OpenAI Unveils 'Tasks' Feature for ChatGPT to Compete with Alexa and Siri

Published: January 15, 2025 09:44 am IST | Source: The Hindu

OpenAI has introduced a new beta feature called Tasks to ChatGPT, marking its entry into the virtual assistant market where it will compete with established services like Amazon's Alexa and Apple's Siri.

  • Tasks allows users to request future actions like reminders and updates.
  • ChatGPT may suggest tasks based on user interactions, which can be accepted or declined.
  • The feature aims to keep ChatGPT competitive following the rise of AI in personal assistance.
  • Amazon and Apple are also enhancing their AI capabilities in response to the growing trend.
“The revamped version of Alexa—which will take actions for users without prompting—is slated to be released in the 'coming months',” said Amazon CEO Andy Jassy.

The rollout of Tasks will begin with Plus, Team, and Pro users, starting with the web platform.
newTitle: OpenAI Unveils 'Tasks' Feature for ChatGPT to Compete with Alexa and Siri

Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 results preview: Net profit seen up 6%, margin expansion expected - Moneycontrol
summary:
Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 Results Preview: Net Profit Expected to Rise by 6%

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Reliance Industries is poised to report stronger financial results for Q3 FY25, driven by gross refining margins and digital service growth.

  • Net profit is forecasted to increase by 6% to Rs 17,482 crore.
  • EBITDA is expected to reveal over 5% growth, reaching Rs 41,125 crore.
  • The revenue is also predicted to rise on a quarterly basis.
  • Expectations include improved EBITDA margins between 18.2% to 18.9%.
  • Growth in digital services is influenced by the recent tariff hikes.
“RIL is expected to benefit from stronger gross refining margins and higher ARPU in digital services.”

In conclusion, Reliance Industries' upcoming financial report is anticipated to reflect solid profit growth, marking a positive milestone for the company's future performance.
newTitle: Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 Results Preview: Net Profit Expected to Rise by 6%
